case_circumstances: On 12/24/77 the subject was found lying on the street (location unknown), unresponsive.  He was taken to San Francisco General Hospital where he was admitted and taken to surgery to evacuate a large right subdural with severe temporal lobe contusions noted.  Burr holes then revealed a left epidural hematoma.  He remained comatose, but brain stem function remained.  He had gastrointestinal bleeding after the operation and a small extracerebral mass was found.  He was then transferred to Laguna Honda Hospital and remained there until he expired about three months later on 2/11/78.
case_head_hair: Short with a patchy area of baldness
case_body_hair: The chest and abdomen is covered by hair
dental: Dental information / charting is available and entered
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
